code.description: Error code which qualifies the error

details.description: Human readable explanation specific to the occurrence of the problem

location.description: The name of the field that resulted in the error

moreInfo.description: URI to human readable documentation of the error

type.description:
invalid - Request did not confirm to the specification and was unprocessed & rejected. Please fix the value and try again

warn - Request was partially processed. E.g. some of the fields are missing in response to the system issues, request was accepted successfully but will be processed asynchronously

error - The request was accepted but could not be processed successfully

fatal - There was an internal system error while processing the request. These are technical errors and will be resolved by Citi, and the consumer should retry after some time. Business errors will not be categorized as fatal

carrier.description: The carrier of customer's new phone number
The carrier of customer's new phone number

phoneNumber.description: The customer's new mobile phone number

lastLoginTime.description: Last successful login timestamp in ISO-8601 UTC format,

info.description: These API's are used to authenticate a CCP user and establish a profile in CCS with userID/password credentials and use a federated profile in CCS that is tied to the userID/password credentials.. These APIs support functions such as retrieving a customer masked name, validating user credentials, changing userID/password, recovering userID, resetting password, hard blocking a user etc.
info.title: Usermanagement

post.description: Login a registered customer using their userID and encrypted or clear password. Returns the timestamp of their last login and cif. For native applications alone, an encrypted eventID and eventID expiration time will be passed in the response header.

parameters.description: A 128 bit universally unique identifier (UUID) that you generate for every request and is used for tracking. It is recommended to use the output from Java UUID class or an equivalent.
parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response. Currently we support application/json
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: Content-Typee in http header. Currently we support application/json
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: HTTP Accept-Language header
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: 2 character ISO country code
parameters.name: countryCode

parameters.description: 3 character business code
parameters.name: businessCode

parameters.description: channel ID used by the user
parameters.name: channelId

parameters.description: sid
parameters.name: sid

parameters.description: The client ID  you received during application registration in the developer portal
parameters.name: client_id

patch.description: This api is used to edit the users password information. For native applications alone, an encrypted eventID will be passed in the response header. This API should be called only in post login context. If called in preLogin, you can expect '403' forbidden error.
